answers.answer: Hello,yes high blood sugar can make her feel hot.Having blooding sugars in the 300-350 range is very dangerous.  She can develop diabetic ketoacidosis, which can be fatal.Consider that normal blood sugars are typically in the range of 80-120! She is nearly 3x maximum normal levels.She needs to see her doctor and be on medication (most likley insulin).  If she doesn't take medications and control her blood sugar/diabetes, she may not live very long.I hope you can help encourage her to get the help she needs.Let us know how you and she go.

question: My question is my girlfriend is frequently complaining about feeling hot at night especially when she is ready for bed.  Her diabetes are definitely uncontrolled since she is not under mediation but when she checks her sugar it can be in the 300-350 range quite regularly. Can anyone tell me can uncontrolled diabetes cause one to feel hot all the time? I greatly appreciate some insite thank you.
title: Diabetes Type2 feeling hot
